  • Description: On May 29, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Morpholine 99% was damaged by a forklift and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. The crew placed the damaged drum of product into one (1) 95-gallon overpack for waste. Granular absorbents and soda ash were deployed to the release, worked in with hand tools, and containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.description:
Report E-2025050560

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-27
  • City: BROWNWOOD
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 27, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of Waste Paint Related Material had a loose cap and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. Five (5) 55-gallon drums of the same product had swollen lids. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. LSH personnel patched the damaged drum of paint, then switched the swollen lids to vented bung lids on the five (5) swollen drums. The crew utilized volcanic ash and absorbent wipes to remediate the trailer floor All impacted material was collected in one (1) 5-gallon container for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025050393
item.description:
Report E-2025050393

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-12
  • City: DALLAS
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On May 12, 2025, nineteen (19) 1-gallon pails of paint (PG II) and one (1) 4-gallon pail of paint (PG II) were damaged by a forklift and released approximately 15-20 gallons of product to the trailer interior, pallets, and nearby freight. The 1-gallon pails damaged include SHER-WOOD Color Express Precat Matte White Tint Base (3 pails), KEM 400 Enamel Blending Clear (8 pails), Polane T Polyurethane Enamel Blending Clear (8 pails). The one (1) damaged 4-gallon pail included POLANE B Polyurethane Enamel (Part A) Clear (PG II). R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Safety and Health Consulting Services (ES&H) to remediate the site. All of the damaged pails and the remaining product in the pails were containerized and solidified using absorbents within one (1) 55-gallon drum. The crew utilized absorbent pads and granular absorbents to remove the paint from the trailer interior and adjacent freight, which were containerized in the previously mentioned 55-gallon drum. The impacted pallets were dismantled and containerized in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025060170
item.description:
Report E-2025060170

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-10
  • City: GRAND PRAIRIE
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Roadrunner Transportation Systems terminal personnel stated that two (2) ounces of material released from four (4) 1-gallon plastic bottles shipped in a cardboard box. The bottles were crushed during transit due to improper loading. The released material impacted the cardboard packaging. Terminal personnel overpacked the damaged bottles and impacted cardboard into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Roadrunner Transportation Systems contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060169
item.description:
Report E-2025060169

Identified by scraper @ 2025-06-22T01:13:25+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-09
  • City: ELMENDORF
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MATRIX INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 30790
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On May 9, 2025. at 07:30 I've received a call from our driver. He noticed that there was a leak coming from a front end of the trailer and immediately called our office. The driver told me he was going to delivery at 15780 Alamo Jct. Elmendorf, TX 78112, he missed the left turn towards the Alamo Jct. (coming from the north on Richter Rd) and kept going south on Richter Rd and did a multipoint turn. That's where the load shifted and one of the IBCs got punctured by dunnage (wooden pallet, hole size 2 by 4) that shipper loaded up all the way in front of the trailer. A leak started and the driver called us immediately. If the shipper didn't load us with dunnage at the front of the trailer, the broken dunnage (pallet) wouldn't puncture the IBC even with the load shift that occurred. The duration of release was approximately 3hrs. No injuries or other damage were reported. I called Chemtrec (ER contact) and they advised me to call the Receiver (Univar) because they were just 20 yards down the road to have them try to contain the spill. On-site Univar Solutions personnel deployed granular absorbents and soda ash to contain and neutralize the release. Additionally, an 85-gallon drum was placed under the leaking tote to provide further containment until crews arrived. At approximately 8:29 AM CDT, a representative from Univar Solutions (US) retained Cura Emergency Services, L.C. (CES) to manage the environmental remediation of the site on their behalf. Based on the available information, the CES incident manager dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to assess and remediate the site as necessary.
